thread.title: Boston's Beloved Police Cat Moves Into Upscale New Home
thread.title_full: Boston's Beloved Police Cat Moves Into Upscale New Home

author: Hilary Hanson
title: Boston's Beloved Police Cat Moves Into Upscale New Home

organizations.name: beloved police cat moves into upscale new home boston

text:
Boston's Beloved Police Cat Moves Into Upscale New Home SWAT Cat will now enjoy a palatial studio with "panoramic city views." 02/15/2017 05:37 pm ET Hilary Hanson Trends Editor, The Huffington Post 
The cutest member of Boston’s police force is living in style. 
SWAT Cat, the unofficial feline mascot of the police Special Weapons and Tactics unit, just got a snazzy, brand-new “kitty condo,” courtesy of Boston officers. Boston Police Department SWAT Cat in front of her new digs. 
The calico endeared herself to officers back in 2013 , when she was a scrappy stray hanging around the SWAT headquarters. Soon, she began taking on crucial law enforcement duties, like getting belly rubs and snoozing atop officers’ motorcycles. 
Officers got her spayed, microchipped with an ID, and vaccinated. But try as they might, they could never get her to be a fully indoor cat. 
“The men and women of the BPD SWAT Team have tried numerous tactics over the years to convince her to come in from the elements but she is set in her ways,” the police department said on its Facebook page. Boston Police Department An unidentified officer works on SWAT Cat's housing. 
SWAT officers built the cat several shelters to protect her from the elements. 
The new deluxe condo is the best one yet. It features a “studio interior layout,” as well as a deck and glass doors with “panoramic city views.” The police department noted in a press release that Officer Jamie Pietroski stayed late after work several nights to complete the prime piece of real estate. 
“They have built numerous shelters for her in the past ― none more impressive than this one which is fully insulated and suits her independent lifestyle,” the department said on Facebook. Boston Police Department SWAT Cat has been the force's unofficial mascot since 2013. 
SWAT Cat caused a citywide panic in 2015, when she vanished without warning, but she returned to SWAT headquarters a month later, safe and sound. Maybe the new condo will convince her to stick closer to home. Also on HuffPost
